Title: Dell OptiPlex GX260 Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the dell optiplex gx260 down on a clean flat surface with the rear towards you .
push the oval shaped buttons located on the top and bottom of the pc simultaneously and lift the case straight up .
note : some force may be required to push in the oval buttons open the pc case .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the Dell Optiplex GX260 down on a clean flat surface with the rear towards you. Push the  oval shaped buttons located on the top and bottom of the PC simultaneously and lift the case straight up. Note: Some force may be required to push in the oval buttons open the PC case.

Lines.Text: disconnect the fan cable from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the fan cable from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: on the rear of the desktop , push the two circled black buttons straight in with a small pointed object while pulling up on the fan .
once the fan is released , lift it straight up and out of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: On the rear of the desktop, push the two circled black buttons straight in with a small pointed object while pulling up on the fan. Once the fan is released, lift it straight up and out of the case.

Lines.Text: push out on the cream colored tabs on each side of each ram module until it pops up and out of its slot and remove the ram .

Steps.Text_raw: Push out on the cream colored tabs on each side of each RAM module until it pops up and out of its slot and remove the RAM.

Lines.Text: disconnect the atx power cable to the motherboard .
disconnect the p4 12 v ( 4x2 ) power cable from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the ATX power cable to the motherboard. Disconnect the P4 12V(4x2) power cable from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: disconnect the front panel ribbon cable by gently pulling it straight up .
disconnect the hard drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the blue tab away from the motherboard .
disconnect the optical drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the orange tab away from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the front panel ribbon cable by gently pulling it straight up. Disconnect the hard drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the blue tab away from the motherboard. Disconnect the optical drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the orange tab away from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: disconnect the floppy drive drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the black tab away from the motherboard .
disconnect the optical drive audio cable connector from the motherboard .
disconnect the audio input/output cable from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the floppy drive drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the black tab away from the motherboard. Disconnect the  optical drive audio cable connector from the motherboard. Disconnect the audio input/output cable from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: lift the metal tab near the right corner of the motherboard .
pull the green tab toward the front of the pc to release the motherboard .
from the rear of the pc , push the ports in while lifting the motherboard up and flipping it away from you .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the metal tab near the right corner of the motherboard. Pull the green tab toward the front of the PC to release the motherboard. From the rear of the PC, push the ports in while lifting the motherboard up and flipping it away from you.

Lines.Text: stand the motherboard up as shown .
insert the flat end of a spudger into the slot in the motherboard mounting plate and press the release tab while pushing the extension plate to the right with your thumbs until it comes off . .

Steps.Text_raw: Stand the motherboard up as shown. Insert the flat end of a spudger into the slot in the motherboard mounting plate and press the release tab while pushing the extension plate to the right with your thumbs until it comes off..

Lines.Text: remove the screw at the rear of the motherboard .
grasp the heat sink with your left hand and the i/o port panel with your right hand and pull to separate motherboard from the metal base .
if you are replacing the motherboard refer to the great guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw at the rear of the motherboard. Grasp the heat sink with your left hand and the I/O port panel with your right hand and pull to separate motherboard from the metal base. If you are replacing the motherboard refer to the great [guide|4002|iFixit guide for removing the CPU].

Subject: Motherboard

Title: Dell OptiPlex GX260 Power Capacitor Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the dell optiplex gx260 down on a clean flat surface with the rear towards you .
push the oval shaped buttons located on the top and bottom of the pc simultaneously and lift the case straight up .
note : some force may be required to push in the oval buttons open the pc case .

once the fan is released , lift it straight up and out of the case .

disconnect the p4 12 v ( 4x2 ) power cable from the motherboard .

disconnect the hard drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the blue tab away from the motherboard .
disconnect the optical drive ribbon cable by gently pulling the orange tab away from the motherboard .

disconnect the optical drive audio cable connector from the motherboard .

Lines.Text: lift the metal tab near the right corner of the motherboard .
pull the green tab toward the front of the pc to release the motherboard .
from the rear of the pc , push the ports in while lifting the motherboard up and flipping it away from you .

Lines.Text: remove the screw at the rear of the motherboard .
grasp the heat sink with your left hand and the i/o port panel with your right hand and pull to separate motherboard from the metal base .
if you are replacing the motherboard refer to the great guide .

Grasp the heat sink with your left hand and the I/O port panel with your right hand and pull to separate motherboard from the metal base. If you are replacing the motherboard refer to the great [guide|4002|iFixit guide for removing the CPU].

Lines.Text: with the motherboard out of the tray , let your soldering gear warm up and get a desoldering braid .
since this isn't a optiplex gx260 motherboard , i have removed the heatsink to get rid of any confusion .

Steps.Text_raw: With the motherboard out of the tray, let your soldering gear warm up and get a desoldering braid. Since this isn't a Optiplex GX260 motherboard, I have removed the heatsink to get rid of any confusion.

Lines.Text: take note of which way the positive lead marker on the capacitor is facing before removing it . you will need to know for the next step .

desoldering can damage motherboards , so first practice on a board you don't need . use a 40-50 w soldering iron with a chisel tip and 0.080 wide desoldering braid . also helpful are rosin flux and 60 /40 tin/lead solder , in case all the solder doesn't come out . wiggle desoldered leads to verify they're free , and never pull on any that aren't .

Steps.Text_raw: Take note of which way the positive lead marker on the capacitor is facing before removing it. You will need to know for the next step. Desoldering can damage motherboards, so first practice on a board you don't need.  Use a 40-50W soldering iron with a chisel tip and 0.080" wide desoldering braid.  Also helpful are rosin flux and 60/40 tin/lead solder, in case all the solder doesn't come out.   Wiggle desoldered leads to verify they're free, and never pull on any that aren't.

Lines.Text: install the new capacitor in the holes left by the old one , then solder it into place .
caution : ensure that the new capacitor is inserted with the positive lead mark facing the same direction as the old capacitor . if the direction is switched , the new capacitor will fail .

Steps.Text_raw: Install the new capacitor in the holes left by the old one, then solder it into place. Caution: Ensure that the new capacitor is inserted with the positive lead mark facing the same direction as the old capacitor. If the direction is switched, the new capacitor will fail.

Subject: Power Capacitor

Title: TRS-80 Color Computer Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the computer over .
remove the two 24.1 mm phillips screws near the front of the case .
remove the five 33.0 mm phillips screws towards the back of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over. Remove the two 24.1mm Phillips screws near the front of the case. Remove the five 33.0 mm Phillips screws towards the back of the case.

Lines.Text: carefully flip the computer right side up .
lift off the top half of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully flip the computer right side up. Lift off the top half of the case.

Lines.Text: near the motherboard , gently pull the keyboard ribbon cable until it becomes free .
lift the keyboard out of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Near the motherboard, gently pull the keyboard ribbon cable until it becomes free. Lift the keyboard out of the case.

Lines.Text: remove the nine 15.24 mm phillips screws securing the motherboard in place .
when removing the spring door , make sure to keep the door closed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nine 15.24 mm Phillips screws securing the motherboard in place. When removing the spring door, make sure to keep the door closed.

Lines.Text: remove the 5 jumper cables from the motherboard .
once the jumper cables lift the motherboard up gently ; it should lift out easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5 jumper cables from the motherboard. Once the jumper cables lift the motherboard up gently; it should lift out easily.

Lines.Text: remove the two 1.6 inch screws securing the transformer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 1.6 inch screws securing the transformer.

Lines.Text: remove the power cord's three leads from the transformer .
note the orientation and color of the three leads . make sure to replace these exactely as they were .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the power cord's three leads from the transformer. Note the orientation and color of the three leads. Make sure to replace these exactely as they were.

Lines.Text: using needle-nose pliers , pinch the tabs of the grommet holding the power cord to the case and push the grommet out .
remove the entire length of cord from the case and replace with a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Using needle-nose pliers, pinch the tabs of the grommet holding the power cord to the case and push the grommet out. Remove the entire length of cord from the case and replace with a new one.

Subject: Power Cord

remove the two 24.1 mm phillips screws near the front of the case .
remove the five 33.0 mm phillips screws towards the back of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over. Remove the two 24.1mm Phillips screws near the front of the case. Remove the five 33.0 mm Phillips screws towards the back of the case.

lift off the top half of the case .

Lines.Text: near the motherboard , gently pull the keyboard ribbon cable until it becomes free .
lift the keyboard out of the case .

when removing the spring door , make sure to keep the door closed .

once the jumper cables lift the motherboard up gently ; it should lift out easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5 jumper cables from the motherboard. Once the jumper cables lift the motherboard up gently; it should lift out easily.

Lines.Text: remove the two 40.6 mm phillips screws securing the trs-80 transformer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 40.6mm Philips screws securing the TRS-80 transformer.

Lines.Text: remove the power cable jumpers from the power supply .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the power cable jumpers from the power supply.

Lines.Text: gently peel back the protective film on the top of the transformer .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently peel back the protective film on the top of the transformer.

Lines.Text: locate the two points the fuse is soldered into the circuit board .
using a soldering iron and soldering wick , desolder and remove the fuse .
place the new fuse into the location of the old one , and solder it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two points the fuse is soldered into the circuit board. Using a soldering iron and soldering wick, desolder and remove the fuse. Place the new fuse into the location of the old one, and solder it in place.

Subject: Fuse

Title: Removing back panel and components to to get to CPU

Lines.Text: tools your need , flat head screwdriver . phillips screwdriver just for the heatsink on cpu/gpu .
unplug everything and then press the power button twice . obviously it will not power on , this is to just remove stored power in the capacitors for safety .
you'll need to have the screen side laying down .
make sure to put the screen side on a clear soft surface to not damage the touch screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Tools your need, flat head screwdriver. Phillips screwdriver just for the heatsink on CPU/GPU. Unplug everything and then press the power button twice. Obviously it will not power on, this is to just remove stored power in the capacitors for safety. You'll need to have the screen side laying down. Make sure to put the screen side on a clear soft surface to not damage the touch screen.

lift up the kickstand with your hand .

back panel screw compared to other sizes screws that will be removed later .
step 14 has a note on all the screws removed in this guide .

then left them up and remove them off to the side .
what the back side panels look like .
remove both side panels .

memory ram sticks , so-dimm
sata hard drive 3.5
dvd/cd-rom drive

Lines.Text: next we'll be removing this panel .
put your finger under the plastic panel and left up with your finger . the panel should put up a bit , then do the same thing on the other side .
panel once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Next we'll be removing this panel. Put your finger under the plastic panel and left up with your finger. The panel should put up a bit, then do the same thing on the other side. Panel once removed.

Lines.Text: now remove the last panel , just like you did with the last one . it should pop up with your figner and be removed .
put one of your fingers under the plastic and pull up .
what the panel looks like once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the last panel, just like you did with the last one. It should pop up with your figner and be removed. Put one of your fingers under the plastic and pull up. What the panel looks like once removed.

Lines.Text: now remove the hb screws to remove the kickstand . use a flat head screwdriver to remove the four screws .
note : slide the kickstand down so the hook in the metal gets released . this will let you left up and remove the kickstand .
what the kickstand looks like once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the HB screws to remove the kickstand. Use a flat head screwdriver to remove the four screws. Note: Slide the kickstand down so the hook in the metal gets released. This will let you left up and remove the kickstand. What the kickstand looks like once removed.

Lines.Text: now remove the three tc screws to remove the heatsink cover .
note : i took the picture after i removed the three screws . also side note , the tc screws are the same size at the cb screws removed later .
what heatsink cover looks like removed .
the back of the hp touchsmart 300 after the heatsink cover was removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the three TC screws to remove the heatsink cover. Note: I took the picture after I removed the three screws. Also side note, the TC screws are the same size at the CB screws removed later. What heatsink cover looks like removed. The back of the HP Touchsmart 300 after the heatsink cover was removed.

Lines.Text: remove the nine screws labeled cb for the fans cover , with a flat head screwdriver . these are the 8 shown circled , plus 1 more in the central black area .
after the cb screws are removed , lift up the fans cover . it will be tethered by connecting wires to the motherboard . some repairs can be done without untethering , just shifting the cover .

to remove the metal panel entirely ( assumed below ) , you will have to unplug 2+ connectors from the motherboard . ( more if you have a model with active external connectors like catv , etc . ) an alternative may be to detach the external-connector plate from the fans cover with the 3 screws label io-c , leaving just that small plate tethered .
i don't have a picture of this fans cover . just be aware it is the biggest metal panel removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nine screws labeled "CB" for the fans cover, with a flat head screwdriver.  These are the 8 shown circled, plus 1 more in the central black area. After the CB screws are removed, lift up the fans cover.  It will be tethered by connecting wires to the motherboard.  Some repairs can be done without untethering, just shifting the cover. To remove the metal panel entirely (assumed below), you will have to unplug 2+ connectors from the motherboard.  (More if you have a model with active external connectors like CATV, etc.)  An alternative may be to detach the external-connector plate from the fans cover with the 3 screws label "IO-C", leaving just that small plate tethered. I don't have a picture of this fans cover. Just be aware it is the biggest metal panel removed.

Lines.Text: when remove the cpu heatsink it's best to heat up the heatsink with a blow dryer so the thermal paste heats up . this way you don't rip the cpu out of the motherboard socket .
remove the cpu heatsink screws .

make sure you do the normal cpu unscrew method . for example , start with the upper left , unscrew just a bit , then go to the lower right and unscrew just a bit . next jump to the lower left , unscrew just a bit , then next the upper right . continue this until you can remove it .

if the heatsink doesn't easily left up , heat it up more with a blow dryer . to make sure you don't rip out the cpu . ripping out the cpu from the motherboards socket could damage the cpu and the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: When remove the CPU heatsink it's best to heat up the heatsink with a blow dryer so the thermal paste heats up. This way you don't rip the CPU out of the motherboard socket. Remove the CPU heatsink screws. Make sure you do the normal CPU unscrew method. For example, start with the upper left, unscrew just a bit, then go to the lower right and unscrew just a bit. Next jump to the lower left, unscrew just a bit, then next the upper right. Continue this until you can remove it. If the heatsink doesn't easily left up, heat it up more with a blow dryer. To make sure you don't rip out the CPU. Ripping out the CPU from the motherboards socket could damage the CPU and the motherboard.

Lines.Text: cpu after removing the heatsink .
gpu after removing the heatsink , aka video card .
wifi mini pci card .
fan for the cpu/gpu heatsink .
power supply fan .
now you can replace the cpu .
it's best to clean out both fans , if your having overheating issues . or to prevent it from happening in the future .

Steps.Text_raw: CPU after removing the heatsink. GPU after removing the heatsink, aka video card. WiFi mini PCI card. Fan for the CPU/GPU heatsink. Power supply fan. Now you can replace the CPU. It's best to clean out both fans, if your having overheating issues. Or to prevent it from happening in the future.

Lines.Text: this part is about cleaning .
there is a plastic tray just below the heatsink fan . this can be removed and cleaned if there is a lot of dust in it .
plastic tray once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: This part is about cleaning. There is a plastic tray just below the heatsink fan. This can be removed and cleaned if there is a lot of dust in it. Plastic tray once removed.

Lines.Text: types of screws that have been removed . this is to help when putting back together everything .
tc and cb screws . for the heatsink cover and fans cover metal panels . 11 total
hb screws . for the kickstand . 4 total
screws for the side panels . 2 total
the penny is to help with scale .

Steps.Text_raw: Types of screws that have been removed. This is to help when putting back together everything. TC and CB screws. For the heatsink cover and fans cover metal panels. 11 total HB screws. For the kickstand. 4 total Screws for the side panels. 2 total The penny is to help with scale.

memory ram sticks , so-dimm
sata hard drive 3.5
dvd/cd-rom drive

Steps.Text_raw: Back side panels should now be removed. Memory Ram Sticks, SO-DIMM SATA Hard Drive 3.5" DVD/CD-rom Drive

Lines.Text: next we'll be removing this panel .
put your finger under the plastic panel and left up with your finger . the panel should put up a bit , then do the same thing on the other side .
panel once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Next we'll be removing this panel. Put your finger under the plastic panel and left up with your finger. The panel should put up a bit, then do the same thing on the other side. Panel once removed.

Lines.Text: now remove the last panel , just like you did with the last one . it should pop up with your figner and be removed .
put one of your fingers under the plastic and pull up .
what the panel looks like once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the last panel, just like you did with the last one. It should pop up with your figner and be removed. Put one of your fingers under the plastic and pull up. What the panel looks like once removed.

Lines.Text: now remove the hb screws to remove the kickstand . use a flat head screwdriver to remove the four screws .
note : slide the kickstand down so the hook in the metal gets released . this will let you left up and remove the kickstand .
what the kickstand looks like once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the HB screws to remove the kickstand. Use a flat head screwdriver to remove the four screws. Note: Slide the kickstand down so the hook in the metal gets released. This will let you left up and remove the kickstand. What the kickstand looks like once removed.

Lines.Text: now remove the three tc screws to remove the heatsink cover .
note : i took the picture after i removed the three screws . also side note , the tc screws are the same size at the cb screws removed later .
what heatsink cover looks like removed .
the back of the hp touchsmart 300 after the heatsink cover was removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the three TC screws to remove the heatsink cover. Note: I took the picture after I removed the three screws. Also side note, the TC screws are the same size at the CB screws removed later. What heatsink cover looks like removed. The back of the HP Touchsmart 300 after the heatsink cover was removed.

Lines.Text: remove the nine screws labeled cb for the fans cover , with a flat head screwdriver . these are the 8 shown circled , plus 1 more in the central black area .
after the cb screws are removed , lift up the fans cover . it will be tethered by connecting wires to the motherboard . some repairs can be done without untethering , just shifting the cover .

to remove the metal panel entirely ( assumed below ) , you will have to unplug 2+ connectors from the motherboard . ( more if you have a model with active external connectors like catv , etc . ) an alternative may be to detach the external-connector plate from the fans cover with the 3 screws label io-c , leaving just that small plate tethered .
i don't have a picture of this fans cover . just be aware it is the biggest metal panel removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nine screws labeled "CB" for the fans cover, with a flat head screwdriver.  These are the 8 shown circled, plus 1 more in the central black area. After the CB screws are removed, lift up the fans cover.  It will be tethered by connecting wires to the motherboard.  Some repairs can be done without untethering, just shifting the cover. To remove the metal panel entirely (assumed below), you will have to unplug 2+ connectors from the motherboard.  (More if you have a model with active external connectors like CATV, etc.)  An alternative may be to detach the external-connector plate from the fans cover with the 3 screws label "IO-C", leaving just that small plate tethered. I don't have a picture of this fans cover. Just be aware it is the biggest metal panel removed.

Lines.Text: when remove the cpu heatsink it's best to heat up the heatsink with a blow dryer so the thermal paste heats up . this way you don't rip the cpu out of the motherboard socket .
remove the cpu heatsink screws .

make sure you do the normal cpu unscrew method . for example , start with the upper left , unscrew just a bit , then go to the lower right and unscrew just a bit . next jump to the lower left , unscrew just a bit , then next the upper right . continue this until you can remove it .

if the heatsink doesn't easily left up , heat it up more with a blow dryer . to make sure you don't rip out the cpu . ripping out the cpu from the motherboards socket could damage the cpu and the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: When remove the CPU heatsink it's best to heat up the heatsink with a blow dryer so the thermal paste heats up. This way you don't rip the CPU out of the motherboard socket. Remove the CPU heatsink screws. Make sure you do the normal CPU unscrew method. For example, start with the upper left, unscrew just a bit, then go to the lower right and unscrew just a bit. Next jump to the lower left, unscrew just a bit, then next the upper right. Continue this until you can remove it. If the heatsink doesn't easily left up, heat it up more with a blow dryer. To make sure you don't rip out the CPU. Ripping out the CPU from the motherboards socket could damage the CPU and the motherboard.

Lines.Text: cpu after removing the heatsink .
gpu after removing the heatsink , aka video card .
wifi mini pci card .
fan for the cpu/gpu heatsink .
power supply fan .
now you can replace the cpu .
it's best to clean out both fans , if your having overheating issues . or to prevent it from happening in the future .

Steps.Text_raw: CPU after removing the heatsink. GPU after removing the heatsink, aka video card. WiFi mini PCI card. Fan for the CPU/GPU heatsink. Power supply fan. Now you can replace the CPU. It's best to clean out both fans, if your having overheating issues. Or to prevent it from happening in the future.

there is a plastic tray just below the heatsink fan . this can be removed and cleaned if there is a lot of dust in it .
plastic tray once removed .

Steps.Text_raw: This part is about cleaning. There is a plastic tray just below the heatsink fan. This can be removed and cleaned if there is a lot of dust in it. Plastic tray once removed.

tc and cb screws . for the heatsink cover and fans cover metal panels . 11 total
hb screws . for the kickstand . 4 total
screws for the side panels . 2 total
the penny is to help with scale .

Steps.Text_raw: Types of screws that have been removed. This is to help when putting back together everything. TC and CB screws. For the heatsink cover and fans cover metal panels. 11 total HB screws. For the kickstand. 4 total Screws for the side panels. 2 total The penny is to help with scale.

Lines.Text: follow guide through his step 10. then we need to remove parts of the plastic frame , detailed next . instructions that follow assume that the unit is screen-down with the lower edge and feet facing you .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow  [guide|8931|Ashton's iFixIt instructions] through his Step 10. Then we need to remove parts of the plastic frame, detailed next.  Instructions that follow assume that the unit is screen-down with the lower edge and feet facing you.

Lines.Text: remove the left and right rear trim . to do this , view the plastic frame and find the small rectangular slots outward of each foot and adjoining a seam . insert a flathead screwdriver and pull gently towards you to unhook each trim piece , then complete removal by hand . 2 photos

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the left and right rear trim.  To do this, view the plastic frame and find the small rectangular slots outward of each foot and adjoining a seam.  Insert a flathead screwdriver and pull gently towards you to unhook each trim piece, then complete removal by hand. [ 2 photos]

Lines.Text: remove the feet . also unplug the usb flash drive near the right foot .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the feet.  Also unplug the USB flash drive near the right foot.

Lines.Text: underneath where the side trim was , remove the 6 silver-colored screws indicated . it is not necessary to remove the black screws .

removal of the rear plastic frame can now be done . start at the lower foot edge , and press gently along the length of the mating , perforated plastic front frame , while pulling gently upward on the rear frame . there are 3 hooks along the length of the lower edge to detach by this process . then angle it up and remove the top edge last .

Steps.Text_raw: Underneath where the side trim was, remove the 6 silver-colored screws indicated.  It is not necessary to remove the black screws. Removal of the rear plastic frame can now be done.  Start at the lower “foot” edge, and press gently along the length of the mating, perforated plastic front frame, while pulling gently upward on the rear frame.  There are 3 hooks along the length of the lower edge to detach by this process.  Then angle it up and remove the top edge last.

Lines.Text: the power supply is now exposed at the lower center , but additional items must be cleared away .

begin with the disk drive enclosure to its left , which has a wire bale handle . unscrew the single spring-mounted captive screw ( indicated by a screwdriver symbol ) , and pull up the handle . prop the drive at an angle ( e . g . , with a screwdriver handle ) . it is not necessary to remove the drive .

Steps.Text_raw: The power supply is now exposed at the lower center, but additional items must be cleared away. Begin with the disk drive enclosure to its left, which has a wire bale handle. Unscrew the single spring-mounted captive screw (indicated by a screwdriver symbol), and pull up the handle.  Prop the drive at an angle (e.g., with a screwdriver handle).  It is not necessary to remove the drive.

Lines.Text: remove the 3 screws holding the smaller fan unit that abuts the power supply , and remove it and the plastic duct shim .
gently unplug the p2 connector ( not shown ) between this fan and power supply .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 3 screws holding the smaller fan unit that abuts the power supply, and remove it and the plastic duct shim. Gently unplug the P2 connector (not shown) between this fan and power supply.

Lines.Text: remove 3 screws ( 2 marked ps-u ) holding the power supply in place . a fourth screw , nearest the frame edge , is not necessary to remove ; it secures the power supply cradle .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 3 screws (2 marked “PS-U”) holding the power supply in place.  A fourth screw, nearest the frame edge, is not necessary to remove; it secures the power supply cradle.

Lines.Text: the power supply is mechanically loose . to finish removal , first detach connector p1 from the motherboard as shown ( pry at alternating ends of seam with thin screwdriver while initially pressing the part of black central latch closest to you ) .
also detach white connector p3 , that runs under the fan ( and note clip ) to the circuit board protruding from under the dvd drive cage . again , a thin screwdriver can help .

Steps.Text_raw: The power supply is mechanically loose.  To finish removal, first detach connector P1 from the motherboard as shown (pry at alternating ends of seam with thin screwdriver while initially pressing the part of black central latch closest to you). Also detach white connector P3, that runs under the fan (and note clip) to the circuit board protruding from under the DVD drive cage.  Again, a thin screwdriver can help.

Subject: Power Supply

Title: Dell Inspiron One 2020 Hard Drive Replacement

Lines.Text: place the all in one computer face down on a soft , clean surface to avoid scratching the front .
press the tab on the stand cover and lift up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the all in one computer face down on a soft, clean surface to avoid scratching the front. Press the tab on the stand cover and lift up.

Lines.Text: remove the four phillips screws that attach the stand to the computer .
tilt the stand up and out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four phillips screws that attach the stand to the computer. Tilt the stand up and out.

Lines.Text: starting from the optical drive , pry the back cover up with a plastic spudger .
the cover is held in place by fragile plastic clips . careful to not break them .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting from the optical drive, pry the back cover up with a plastic spudger. The cover is held in place by fragile plastic clips.  Careful to not break them.

Lines.Text: remove the three screws that hold the hard drive cage to the chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three screws that hold the hard drive cage to the chassis.

Lines.Text: slide the hard drive cage out slightly to access and remove the power and sata cable .
there isn't much slack in these cables , so don't slide the hard drive cage to far .
the power and sata cables are connected together . on most other computers , these connectors are separate .
lift the hard drive cage out .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the hard drive cage out slightly to access and remove the power and SATA cable. There isn't much slack in these cables, so don't slide the hard drive cage to far. The power and SATA cables are connected together.  On most other computers, these connectors are separate. Lift the hard drive cage out.

Lines.Text: remove the four screws ( two on each side ) that attach the hard drive cage to the hard drive .
lift the hard drive cage off the hard drive .

this helps drain any remaining power stored in the capacitors , so that you can safely work on the internal components .

Title: Commodore 64 Removing the Shift-Lock Key

Lines.Text: 1. remove three 6.75 mm ph2 screw heads from the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: 1. Remove three 6.75mm ph2 screw heads from the casing.

Lines.Text: 2. split the case of the c64 open by pulling up on the case towards you
do not pull too hard that you break the clips .

Steps.Text_raw: 2. Split the case of the C64 open by pulling up on the case towards you Do not pull too hard that you break the clips.

Lines.Text: 3. remove eight 6.75 mm ph2 screw heads to detach the keyboard face from the front casing . ( two remaining screws on the right side . )

Steps.Text_raw: 3. Remove eight 6.75 mm ph2 screw heads to detach the keyboard face from the     front casing. (Two remaining screws on the right side.)

Lines.Text: 4. remove twenty-three 3.38 mm ph2 screw heads from the back of the keyboard facing

Steps.Text_raw: 4. Remove twenty-three 3.38 mm ph2 screw heads from the back of the keyboard facing

Lines.Text: 5. detach the multi-colored wire bundles connected to the motherboard

Steps.Text_raw: 5. Detach the multi-colored wire bundles connected to the motherboard

Lines.Text: 6. next , carefully cut the two small wires which are connected from the shift/lock key to the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: 6. Next, carefully cut the two small wires which are connected from the Shift/Lock key to the keyboard.

Lines.Text: 7. turn the keyboard down on its face and push the shift lock key out from the back of the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: 7. Turn the keyboard down on its face and push the shift lock key out from the back of the keyboard.

Lines.Text: 8. you can remove the circuit component ( gray piece attached to the shift lock key spring ) by pulling back slightly on its clip and pulling it apart from the shift lock key button .
take off the shift key button from the spring by using any phillips screwdriver to pry it off from the spring .

Steps.Text_raw: 8. You can remove the circuit component (gray piece attached to the shift lock key spring) by pulling back slightly on its clip and pulling it apart from the shift lock key button. * Take off the shift key button from the spring by using any Philips screwdriver to pry it off from the spring.

Lines.Text: remove the two foam bumpers that lie on top of the two front usb ports with fingers . do not throw them away .

Lines.Text: disconnect the speaker cable from the motherboard by gently pulling it straight up to disengage it from the port .
remove the four 4 mm phillips 0 screws that secure the motherboard to the case .
the screw in the corner where the ram is located is covered by a small piece of mylar tape , peel this tape back to reveal the screw . the tweezers can be helpful for this .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the speaker cable from the motherboard by gently pulling it straight up to disengage it from the port. Remove the four 4mm Philips #0 screws that secure the motherboard to the case. The screw in the corner where the RAM is located is covered by a small piece of Mylar tape, peel this tape back to reveal the screw. The tweezers can be helpful for this.

Lines.Text: gently grasp the motherboard by the heat sink ( the black finned piece ) . lift the motherboard at an angle such that the ports along the back side come up first .
continue lifting the motherboard , then slowly tilt the piece off to the right to break the mylar tape over the front usb ports .

be careful when handling the motherboard to prevent electro-static discharge ( esd ) damage . if the motherboard is being removed as part of a prerequisite , place the motherboard into a bag designed to prevent a build up of a static charge ( usually referred to as a static bag ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently grasp the motherboard by the heat sink (the black finned piece). Lift the motherboard at an angle such that the ports along the back side come up first. Continue lifting the motherboard, then slowly tilt the piece off to the right to break the Mylar tape over the front USB ports. Be careful when handling the motherboard to prevent electro-static discharge (ESD) damage. If the motherboard is being removed as part of a prerequisite, place the motherboard into a bag designed to prevent a build up of a static charge (usually referred to as a static bag).

Lines.Text: remove the 5 mm phillips 0 screw securing the speaker mounting bracket to the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 5mm Philips #0 screw securing the speaker mounting bracket to the case.

Lines.Text: grasp the speaker mounting bracket and lift it up from the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the speaker mounting bracket and lift it up from the case.

Lines.Text: run the flat side of the spudger along the entire line of the case starting from the back where the power plug and a small screw are located .
use care to not apply excessive force that could damage retaining clips while running the spudger along the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Run the flat side of the spudger along the entire line of the case starting from the back where the power plug and a small screw are located. Use care to not apply excessive force that could damage retaining clips while running the spudger along the case.

Lines.Text: once the clips have been released , gently disengage the cover from the rest of case by pulling in opposite directions .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the clips have been released, gently disengage the cover from the rest of case by pulling in opposite directions.

Lines.Text: using fingers , push the clips on either side of the ram . the ram will pop up at a 45 degree angle when both clips are disengaged .

Steps.Text_raw: Using fingers, push the clips on either side of the RAM. The RAM will pop up at a 45 degree angle when both clips are disengaged.

Lines.Text: lift and pull out the ram .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and pull out the RAM.

Lines.Text: using the spudger , gently push on the underside of the memory board to loosen it . gently grasp each side and pull up to release the memory board .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the spudger, gently push on the underside of the memory board to loosen it. Gently grasp each side and pull up to release the memory board.

Lines.Text: to remove the battery , pull up on the connector that is plugged into the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the battery, pull up on the connector that is plugged into the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove the two 4 mm phillips 00 screws that are along the back of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 4mm Phillips #00 screws that are along the back of the case.

Lines.Text: remove the two foam bumpers that lie on top of the two front usb ports with fingers . do not throw them away .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two foam bumpers that lie on top of the two front USB ports with fingers. Do not throw them away.

Lines.Text: disconnect the speaker cable from the motherboard by gently pulling it straight up to disengage it from the port .
remove the four 4 mm phillips 0 screws that secure the motherboard to the case .
the screw in the corner where the ram is located is covered by a small piece of mylar tape , peel this tape back to reveal the screw . the tweezers can be helpful for this .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the speaker cable from the motherboard by gently pulling it straight up to disengage it from the port. Remove the four 4mm Philips #0 screws that secure the motherboard to the case. The screw in the corner where the RAM is located is covered by a small piece of Mylar tape, peel this tape back to reveal the screw. The tweezers can be helpful for this.

Lines.Text: gently grasp the motherboard by the heat sink ( the black finned piece ) . lift the motherboard at an angle such that the ports along the back side come up first .
continue lifting the motherboard , then slowly tilt the piece off to the right to break the mylar tape over the front usb ports .

be careful when handling the motherboard to prevent electro-static discharge ( esd ) damage . if the motherboard is being removed as part of a prerequisite , place the motherboard into a bag designed to prevent a build up of a static charge ( usually referred to as a static bag ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently grasp the motherboard by the heat sink (the black finned piece). Lift the motherboard at an angle such that the ports along the back side come up first. Continue lifting the motherboard, then slowly tilt the piece off to the right to break the Mylar tape over the front USB ports. Be careful when handling the motherboard to prevent electro-static discharge (ESD) damage. If the motherboard is being removed as part of a prerequisite, place the motherboard into a bag designed to prevent a build up of a static charge (usually referred to as a static bag).

Subject: Motherboard

Title: Dell Inspiron 530 DCMF Bios Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: unscrew the two screws shown that are holding on the side panel . then slide the side panel towards the back to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two screws shown that are holding on the side panel. Then slide the side panel towards the back to remove it.

Lines.Text: locate the bios battery as shown . using you fingers or a spudger , pop it out from the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the Bios battery as shown. Using you fingers or a spudger, pop it out from the side.

Subject: Bios Battery

Title: Desktop PC Motherboard Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the computer from the power supply before any maintenance or disassembly .
remove the two phillips 2 head 5 mm screws from the back side of the computer case . you only need to remove the screws that hold down the panel .
these screws can usually be removed by hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the computer from the power supply before any maintenance or disassembly. Remove the two Phillips #2 head 5mm screws from the back side of the computer case. You only need to remove the screws that hold down the panel. These screws can usually be removed by hand.

Lines.Text: next , remove the side panel of the computer case to allow access into the computer . slide the panel towards the back of the computer and lift it up to remove .
if there is a fan mounted on the side panel , make sure to unplug the cable before fully removing the panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, remove the side panel of the computer case to allow access into the computer. Slide the panel towards the back of the computer and lift it up to remove. If there is a fan mounted on the side panel, make sure to unplug the cable before fully removing the panel.

Lines.Text: remove two phillips 2 head 5 mm screws from the back side of the computer case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two Phillips #2 head 5mm screws from the back side of the computer case.

Lines.Text: next , remove the side panel of the computer case to allow access into the computer .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, remove the side panel of the computer case to allow access into the computer.

Lines.Text: remove the phillips 2 head , 5 mm screw holding the graphics card in place .
make sure that you have grounded yourself so that upon removal of the graphics card you do not accidentally shock the circuit board and damage it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Phillips #2 head, 5mm screw holding the graphics card in place. Make sure that you have grounded yourself so that upon removal of the graphics card you do not accidentally shock the circuit board and damage it.

Lines.Text: press the latch on the side of the connector area to unlock the graphics card , and carefully slide the graphics card out from its slot in the computer .
a good technique is to lay the computer onto it side , push the latch down and lift the graphics card out .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the latch on the side of the connector area to unlock the graphics card, and carefully slide the graphics card out from its slot in the computer. A good technique is to lay the computer onto it side, push the latch down and lift the graphics card out.

Lines.Text: remove two phillips 2 head 5 mm screws holding the hard drive in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two Phillips #2 head 5mm screws holding the hard drive in place.

Lines.Text: remove two phillips 2 head 5 mm screws holding in the other side of the hard drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two Phillips #2 head 5mm screws holding in the other side of the hard drive.

Lines.Text: slide the hard drive out from the metal casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the hard drive out from the metal casing.

Lines.Text: remove the cables from the back of the hard drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cables from the back of the hard drive.

Lines.Text: begin to disconnect all cables from the motherboard . many of the cables will have clips that need to be undone before you can remove them from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin to disconnect all cables from the motherboard. Many of the cables will have clips that need to be undone before you can remove them from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove eight phillips 2 head 5 mm screws from the motherboard . be sure to have your computer on its side , so that once the screws are out nothing falls and get damaged .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove eight Phillips #2 head 5mm screws from the motherboard. Be sure to have your computer on its side, so that once the screws are out nothing falls and get damaged.

Lines.Text: double check and make sure all wires and screws have been removed , then carefully remove the motherboard from the computer case .

Steps.Text_raw: Double check and make sure all wires and screws have been removed, then carefully remove the motherboard from the computer case.

Subject: Motherboard

Title: HP ProOne 600 G1 Fan Replacement

Lines.Text: push the unlock tabs on the back of the monitor in and towards each other while sliding the back cover up .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the unlock tabs on the back of the monitor in and towards each other while sliding the back cover up.

Lines.Text: loosen the two 1 /2 screws , with the t15 torx screwdriver , on each side of the stand . remove stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen  the two 1/2" screws , with the T15 Torx Screwdriver, on each side of the stand. Remove stand.

Lines.Text: take out the single 3 /8 screw , with the t15 torx screwdriver , from the middle of the backplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the single 3/8" screw, with the T15 Torx Screwdriver, from the middle of the backplate.

Lines.Text: remove the backplate by pulling it back towards you .
small plastic tabs hold in the backplate , pull these up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the backplate by pulling it back towards you. Small plastic tabs hold in the backplate, pull these up to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove both 3 /8 screws using the t15 torx screwdriver from the metal plate , and slide the plate to the left .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both 3/8" screws using the T15 Torx Screwdriver from the metal plate, and slide the plate to the left.

Lines.Text: unscrew three surrounding 1 /4 screws , with the t15 torx screwdriver . pull out the fan and attached wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew three surrounding 1/4" screws, with the T15 Torx Screwdriver. Pull out the fan and attached wires.

Subject: Fan

Title: HP ProOne 600 G1 Wi-Fi Adapter Replacement

Lines.Text: push the unlock tabs on the back of the monitor in and towards each other while sliding the back cover up .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the unlock tabs on the back of the monitor in and towards each other while sliding the back cover up.

Lines.Text: loosen the two 1 /2 screws , with the t15 torx screwdriver , on each side of the stand . remove stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen  the two 1/2" screws , with the T15 Torx Screwdriver, on each side of the stand. Remove stand.

Lines.Text: take out the single 3 /8 screw , with the t15 torx screwdriver , from the middle of the backplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the single 3/8" screw, with the T15 Torx Screwdriver, from the middle of the backplate.

Lines.Text: remove the backplate by pulling it back towards you .
small plastic tabs hold in the backplate , pull these up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the backplate by pulling it back towards you. Small plastic tabs hold in the backplate, pull these up to remove it.

Lines.Text: locate the wi-fi adapter at the top right corner of where the stand once was .
unscrew the screws using the phillips 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the Wi-Fi adapter at the top right corner of where the stand once was. Unscrew the screws using the Philips #1 Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove wire tabs from the left side of the wi-fi adapter .
remove the adapter

Steps.Text_raw: Remove wire tabs from the left side of the Wi-Fi adapter. Remove the adapter

Subject: Wi-Fi Adapter

Title: HP Envy 700-030qe CD Drive Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure that you are wearing your anti-static wristband . this will prevent damaging any internal parts with any built up static electricity .
unscrew the 10.5 mm screw on the left of the desktop using your hand .
if it is too tight you may use a torx-head screwdriver or a flat-head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure that you are wearing your anti-static wristband. This will prevent damaging any internal parts with any built up static electricity. Unscrew the 10.5mm screw on the left of the desktop using your hand. If it is too tight you may use a torx-head screwdriver or a flat-head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the side panel by sliding it towards the back of the desktop and pulling up on it as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the side panel by sliding it towards the back of the desktop and pulling up on it as shown.

Lines.Text: for the next step , remove the cd drive power cable .

Steps.Text_raw: For the next step, remove the CD drive power cable.

Lines.Text: reorient the device with the front pointing away from you .
next , remove the sata interface cable . it is directly next to the power cable on the cd drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Reorient the device with the front pointing away from you. Next, remove the SATA interface cable. It is directly next to the power cable on the CD drive.

Lines.Text: now pull up and swing the mounting lever in . the lever closest to the front mounts the top drive slot , and the lever farther away mounts the bottom one .

Steps.Text_raw: Now pull up and swing the mounting lever in. The lever closest to the front mounts the top drive slot, and the lever farther away mounts the bottom one.

Lines.Text: now stand your desktop up and remove the 3 clips on the right side of the front panel .
then pull the front panel off , pulling from the side that the clips are on .

Steps.Text_raw: Now stand your desktop up and remove the 3 clips on the right side of the front panel. Then pull the front panel off, pulling from the side that the clips are on.

Lines.Text: now you can pull the cd drive straight out of the casing !

Steps.Text_raw: Now you can pull the CD drive straight out of the casing!

Subject: CD Drive

Title: Disassembling HP ENVY Rove 20-k014us Back Cover

Lines.Text: working on your device while its turned on is potentially dangerous and can result in electrical shock . please make sure your device is completely turned off before you begin disassembling it .
flip the device over so the screen is face down .
make sure the stand is flipped down for the easiest way to work with the device .
make sure that you put the screen on a clean surface to avoid scratching it .

Steps.Text_raw: Working on your device while it’s turned on is potentially dangerous and can result in electrical shock. Please make sure your device is completely turned off before you begin disassembling it. Flip the device over so the screen is face down. Make sure the stand is flipped down for the easiest way to work with the device. Make sure that you put the screen on a clean surface to avoid scratching it.

Lines.Text: remove the sd card in the bottom of the computer by pressing the sd card in , and it will pop out .
pull out the sd card completely and set aside .
if you have never put in an sd card into this slot , a dummy one will be there in the slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the SD card in the bottom of the computer by pressing the SD card in, and it will pop out. Pull out the SD card completely and set aside. If you have never put in an SD card into this slot, a dummy one will be there in the slot.

Lines.Text: remove the two rubber screw covers on the bottom of the plastic cover using the plastic opening tool .
unscrew the two 6.35 mm ph1 screws that were underneath the rubber covers .
the screws cannot be removed , they just unscrew from the interior components of the computer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two rubber screw covers on the bottom of the plastic cover using the plastic opening tool. Unscrew the two 6.35 mm PH#1 screws that were underneath the rubber covers. The screws cannot be removed, they just unscrew from the interior components of the computer.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool along the outer rim of the bottom portion of the back panel .
take off this portion .
removing the cover for the first time requires a bit of force . use the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible before you pull off the cover to help prevent it from cracking .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool along the outer rim of the bottom portion of the back panel. Take off this portion. Removing the cover for the first time requires a bit of force. Use the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible before you pull off the cover to help prevent it from cracking.

Lines.Text: remove three 6.35 mm screw from the back panel using a ph2 or j1 screwdriver .
unscrew the two 6.35 mm ph2 screws . they aren't able to be completely removed and will just be loosened similar to step 3.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove three 6.35 mm screw from the back panel using a PH#2 or J1 screw driver. Unscrew the two 6.35 mm PH#2 screws. They aren't able to be completely removed and will just be loosened similar to step 3.

Lines.Text: release the stand by pressing the large button on the left so that it is easier to take the back case off .

Steps.Text_raw: Release the stand by pressing the large button on the left so that it is easier to take the back case off.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to separate the silver back cover from the screen body .
as shown in picture two , use the tool around the stand as well to avoid cracking the cover .
as with the bottom cover , removing the top cover requires some force . using the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible will make your job easier in the long run .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to separate the silver back cover from the screen body. As shown in picture two,  use the tool around the stand as well to avoid cracking the cover. As with the bottom cover, removing the top cover requires some force. Using the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible will make your job easier in the long run.

Lines.Text: slowly apply pressure to the outsides of the cover until it pops out of place .
carefully lift the cover away from the computer and untangle it from the stand .

when putting the back cover back on , make sure you put the bottom of the cover on first so that the plastic cover sits tightly underneath the bottom of the stand case . then make sure all the plastic tabs are fully pushed in .
make sure that the power button is aligned when you put the back cover on .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly apply pressure to the outsides of the cover until it pops out of place. Carefully lift the cover away from the computer and untangle it from the stand. When putting the back cover back on, make sure you put the bottom of the cover on first so that the plastic cover sits tightly underneath the bottom of the stand case. Then make sure all the plastic tabs are fully pushed in. Make sure that the power button is aligned when you put the back cover on.

Lines.Text: before working on any of the internal components of the computer , make sure the battery is disconnected so there's no power running through the device .
disconnect the battery by using a plastic opening tool and taking the cable connection out .

Steps.Text_raw: Before working on any of the internal components of the computer, make sure the battery is disconnected so there's no power running through the device. Disconnect the battery by using a plastic opening tool and taking the cable connection out.

Subject: Back Cover

Lines.Text: pull apart the white tabs on the outside to release the ram module .
gently remove the ram module from the slot .

when you replace the ram , make sure to align the pins on the ram module with the appropriate slot . then once the ram module is completely in its slot , gently push the module down so the white tabs re-engage with the module in the correct spot .

Lines.Text: working on your device while its turned on is potentially dangerous and can result in electrical shock . please make sure your device is completely turned off before you begin disassembling it .
flip the device over so the screen is face down .
make sure the stand is flipped down for the easiest way to work with the device .
make sure that you put the screen on a clean surface to avoid scratching it .

Steps.Text_raw: Working on your device while it’s turned on is potentially dangerous and can result in electrical shock. Please make sure your device is completely turned off before you begin disassembling it. Flip the device over so the screen is face down. Make sure the stand is flipped down for the easiest way to work with the device. Make sure that you put the screen on a clean surface to avoid scratching it.

Lines.Text: remove the sd card in the bottom of the computer by pressing the sd card in , and it will pop out .
pull out the sd card completely and set aside .
if you have never put in an sd card into this slot , a dummy one will be there in the slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the SD card in the bottom of the computer by pressing the SD card in, and it will pop out. Pull out the SD card completely and set aside. If you have never put in an SD card into this slot, a dummy one will be there in the slot.

Lines.Text: remove the two rubber screw covers on the bottom of the plastic cover using the plastic opening tool .
unscrew the two 6.35 mm ph1 screws that were underneath the rubber covers .
the screws cannot be removed , they just unscrew from the interior components of the computer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two rubber screw covers on the bottom of the plastic cover using the plastic opening tool. Unscrew the two 6.35 mm PH#1 screws that were underneath the rubber covers. The screws cannot be removed, they just unscrew from the interior components of the computer.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool along the outer rim of the bottom portion of the back panel .
take off this portion .
removing the cover for the first time requires a bit of force . use the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible before you pull off the cover to help prevent it from cracking .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool along the outer rim of the bottom portion of the back panel. Take off this portion. Removing the cover for the first time requires a bit of force. Use the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible before you pull off the cover to help prevent it from cracking.

Lines.Text: remove three 6.35 mm screw from the back panel using a ph2 or j1 screwdriver .
unscrew the two 6.35 mm ph2 screws . they aren't able to be completely removed and will just be loosened similar to step 3.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove three 6.35 mm screw from the back panel using a PH#2 or J1 screw driver. Unscrew the two 6.35 mm PH#2 screws. They aren't able to be completely removed and will just be loosened similar to step 3.

Lines.Text: release the stand by pressing the large button on the left so that it is easier to take the back case off .

Steps.Text_raw: Release the stand by pressing the large button on the left so that it is easier to take the back case off.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to separate the silver back cover from the screen body .
as shown in picture two , use the tool around the stand as well to avoid cracking the cover .
as with the bottom cover , removing the top cover requires some force . using the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible will make your job easier in the long run .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to separate the silver back cover from the screen body. As shown in picture two,  use the tool around the stand as well to avoid cracking the cover. As with the bottom cover, removing the top cover requires some force. Using the plastic opening tool to get as much separation as possible will make your job easier in the long run.

Lines.Text: slowly apply pressure to the outsides of the cover until it pops out of place .
carefully lift the cover away from the computer and untangle it from the stand .

when putting the back cover back on , make sure you put the bottom of the cover on first so that the plastic cover sits tightly underneath the bottom of the stand case . then make sure all the plastic tabs are fully pushed in .
make sure that the power button is aligned when you put the back cover on .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly apply pressure to the outsides of the cover until it pops out of place. Carefully lift the cover away from the computer and untangle it from the stand. When putting the back cover back on, make sure you put the bottom of the cover on first so that the plastic cover sits tightly underneath the bottom of the stand case. Then make sure all the plastic tabs are fully pushed in. Make sure that the power button is aligned when you put the back cover on.

Lines.Text: before working on any of the internal components of the computer , make sure the battery is disconnected so there's no power running through the device .
disconnect the battery by using a plastic opening tool and taking the cable connection out .

Steps.Text_raw: Before working on any of the internal components of the computer, make sure the battery is disconnected so there's no power running through the device. Disconnect the battery by using a plastic opening tool and taking the cable connection out.

Lines.Text: remove the two black 6.35 mm ph 0 screws with a screwdriver from the top of the hard drive .
remove the two silver 6.35 mm ph0 screws from the bottom of the hard drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two black 6.35mm PH #0 screws with a screwdriver from the top of the hard drive. Remove the two silver 6.35mm PH#0 screws from the bottom of the hard drive.

Lines.Text: gently remove the hard drive from the computer .
unplug the hard drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the hard drive from the computer. Unplug the hard drive.

Lines.Text: remove four 3.5 mm ph0 screws on the sides of the hard drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove four 3.5 mm PH#0 screws on the sides of the hard drive.

when replacing the screws around the case , don't cinch them too hard ; just secure the rubber case to the hard drive .

at the same time , pull up on the hard drive . it should slide out smoothly without much effort .

Lines.Text: to completly remove the ssd from its casing , unscrew the four 5 mm screws on opposite ends of the casing . use a torx t15 screwdriver to accomplish this .
notice that the screws to remove are the four screws inside the holes rather than the screws that are next to the holes .

Steps.Text_raw: To completly remove the SSD from its casing, unscrew the four 5mm screws on opposite ends of the casing. Use a Torx T15 screw driver to accomplish this. Notice that the screws to remove are the four screws inside the holes rather than the screws that are next to the holes.

then you may carefully remove the ram chips by pulling them out by their the ends .

remember the slots that you take the ram chips from . you must put the two replacement chips in the same slots .

Title: How to Replace the HP Touchsmart IQ506 CMOS Battery (Quick and Dirty)

Lines.Text: shut the computer down and then unplug the power adapter .

Steps.Text_raw: Shut the computer down and then unplug the power adapter.

Lines.Text: lock the system stand before starting . hold the stand up , while pushing the locking tab towards the side that locks the stand in .

Steps.Text_raw: Lock the system stand before starting. Hold the stand up, while pushing the locking tab towards the side that locks the stand in.

Lines.Text: remove the screw on the ram door . once you remove the screw , unclip the ram door .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw on the RAM door. Once you remove the screw, unclip the RAM door.

Lines.Text: unclip the ram from the ram slots in the machine . put the ram in a esd safe bag , if you can .

Steps.Text_raw: Unclip the RAM from the RAM slots in the machine. Put the RAM in a ESD safe bag, if you can.

Lines.Text: remove the 4 screws from the stand . once you do this , remove it from the system .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 4 screws from the stand. Once you do this, remove it from the system.

Lines.Text: this is when the guide starts to get advanced . do not continue unless you know how to open this machine up and remove the emi shield covering the motherboard , just in case the battery falls in ! '''make sure you use blunt ended tweezers for this . '''
unclip the top of the battery using your fingernails . you do not need to use the tweezers yet .

Steps.Text_raw: This is when the guide starts to get advanced. DO NOT continue unless you know how to open this machine up and remove the EMI shield covering the motherboard, just in case the battery falls in! '''Make sure you use blunt ended tweezers for this.''' Unclip the top of the battery using your fingernails. You do not need to use the tweezers yet.

Lines.Text: with the battery unclipped , go in the machine with your tweezers . pull the battery out while keeping a firm grip to avoid dropping it in the machine .

Steps.Text_raw: With the battery unclipped, go in the machine with your tweezers. Pull the battery out while keeping a firm grip to avoid dropping it in the machine.

Lines.Text: put a note on the ram door out of sight or write the replacement month and year .
if you replaced the battery in may of 2016 , you would write '''5 /16 ''' on the battery . if you wanted to write the month , date and year down , you would have to put a note behind the ram door .

Steps.Text_raw: Put a note on the RAM door out of sight or write the replacement month and year. If you replaced the battery in May of 2016, you would write '''5/16''' on the battery. If you wanted to write the month, date and year down, you would have to put a note behind the RAM door.

Lines.Text: '''make sure you do not drop the battery in the machine here . this is even more crucial . '''

open the new battery , and grab it with the tweezers . '''do not grab too much it will fall in , but not enough it won't stay in your tweezers . you want to grab this battery somewhere in the middle . '''

Steps.Text_raw: '''Make sure you do not drop the battery in the machine here. This is even more crucial.''' Open the new battery, and grab it with the tweezers. '''Do not grab too much it will fall in, but not enough it won't stay in your tweezers. You want to grab this battery somewhere in the middle.'''

Lines.Text: with the battery in the tweezers , '''slowly''' slide the battery in the clip . once you have it in , '''put one finger on the battery while removing the tweezers . '''

Steps.Text_raw: With the battery in the tweezers, '''slowly''' slide the battery in the clip. Once you have it in, '''put one finger on the battery while removing the tweezers.'''

Lines.Text: with the battery in the clip , push down on the battery to lock it in the system .

Steps.Text_raw: With the battery in the clip, push down on the battery to lock it in the system.

Lines.Text: orientate the computer so the case lock is on the left corner , like so .
pull the tab that locks the casing in place .
while the tab is pulled , lift the casing off the computer .

Lines.Text: lift the three tabs locking the face into place . ( the plastic prying tool makes this easier . )
pull the plastic face off of the computer .
